comments.body: @janetkuo @monopole @kargakis please do not merge tests that are ONLY verifying the output of the command without verifying the actual change has been applied. This gives false assumption the command is tested, and adds to the overall tech-debt sig-cli already has, and is currently on a path to clean.
Agree, and I thought we didn't make promises about the output format unless you specify some -o option. So this thing ought not be enforced.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +67,71 @@
	cmd.Run(cmd, []string{deploymentName})
	expectedOutput := "deployment.apps \"" + deploymentName + "\" paused\n"
	if buf.String() != expectedOutput {
		t.Errorf("expected output: %s, but got: %s", expectedOutput, buf.String())
